title: Your Dream Destination with Chin Hin Property
summary: For half a decade, Chin Hin has stood as an epitome of excellence and unyielding customer satisfaction, all under the visionary guidance of its founder, Datuk Seri Chiau Beng Teik.
content:

title: Ministry of Higher Education to help bring back bodies of two students killed in New Zealand road accident
summary: The Ministry of Higher Education will provide assistance to bring back the remains of two Malaysian students, who were killed in a road accident in Lake Tekapo, New Zealand on Saturday.
content:
LUMUT (March 30): The Ministry of Higher Education will provide assistance to bring back the remains of two Malaysian students, who were killed in a road accident in Lake Tekapo, New Zealand on Saturday.

Higher Education Minister Datuk Seri Dr Zambry Abdul Kadir said the ministry is getting feedback and complete information regarding the students from the Foreign Ministry.

"So far, we do not have complete information regarding the matter.

title: Malaysia subjected to 3,000 cyberattacks a day after stating support for Palestine — defence minister
summary: The national defence system is subjected to around 3,000 cyberattacks a day, especially after Malaysia stated its support for Palestine, Defence Minister Datuk Seri Mohamed Khaled Nordin said.
content:
JOHOR BAHRU (March 30): The national defence system is subjected to around 3,000 cyberattacks a day, especially after Malaysia stated its support for Palestine, Defence Minister Datuk Seri Mohamed Khaled Nordin said. 

The attacks involved various parties, and were not only to spy on Malaysia’s movements regarding the Gaza conflicts, but attempts to hack the national defence system.

"The number of attacks rose after Malaysia stated its stand on the Pale

title: Govt still engaging with stakeholders towards finalising details of high-value goods tax — MOF
summary: The government is still engaging with the relevant stakeholders to finalise details of the high-value goods tax (HVGT), including the scope of goods and associated thresholds.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 30): The government is still engaging with the relevant stakeholders to finalise details of the high-value goods tax (HVGT), including the scope of goods and associated thresholds. 

This is to ensure the effectiveness of the tax, without adversely affecting the people’s economy, said the Ministry of Finance (MOF).

“Ultimately, the Madani government aims to strike a delicate balance between improving the country’s

title: Sarawak first state to finance federal projects to speed up implementation — PM
summary:
The Sarawak government will be the first state to provide initial financing for federal projects in the state to speed up their implementation, Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim announced here on Saturday.

He added that the cooperation, which is of historical significance, would begin with the implementation of the Sarawak Cancer Centre here.
content:
KOTA SAMARAHAN (March 30): The Sarawak government will be the first state to provide initial financing for federal projects in the state to speed up their implementation, Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim announced here on Saturday.

He added that the cooperation, which is of historical significance, would begin with the implementation of the Sarawak Cancer Centre here.

"I agree that we use a new method, where Sarawak can start the construction fi

title: Police out in full force to maintain public order, says Saifuddin after second KK Supermart attack
summary: Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail said police will be out in full force to maintain a firm grip on public order in the country, following another firebombing incident, this time aimed at KK Supermart Sungai Isap in Kuantan at 5am on Saturday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 30): Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail said police will be out in full force to maintain a firm grip on public order in the country, following another firebombing incident, this time aimed at KK Supermart Sungai Isap in Kuantan at 5am on Saturday.

He said police view seriously the attempt to set fire to a KK Supermart convenience store, which was the second incident after a similar incident occurred at KK Supermart Bidor, Perak on Tuesday.

title: Bone fragments found in Tongkang Pechah belong to Bella, say police
summary: The police confirmed that bone fragments found in an abandoned house in Tongkang Pechah here on Feb 28 belonged to Bella, the murder victim whose real name was Mila Sharmilah Samsusah.
content:
BATU PAHAT (March 30): The police confirmed that bone fragments found in an abandoned house in Tongkang Pechah here on Feb 28 belonged to Bella, the murder victim whose real name was Mila Sharmilah Samsusah.

Batu Pahat district acting police chief Supt Shahrulanuar Mushaddat Abdullah Sani said that the matter was confirmed by the state Chemistry Department through a deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) test.

“The test found that it matc

title: EV road tax review in final stages, announcement expected next month, says Loke
summary: The Ministry of Transport (MOT) is currently in the final stage of reviewing the road tax rate structure for electric vehicles (EVs), and an announcement is expected next month, said Transport Minister Anthony Loke Siew Fook.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 30): The Ministry of Transport (MOT) is currently in the final stage of reviewing the road tax rate structure for electric vehicles (EVs), and an announcement is expected next month, said Transport Minister Anthony Loke Siew Fook.

He said the decision to review the structure is aimed at making the road tax on EVs cheaper, compared to internal combustion engine (ICE) vehicles, besides encouraging more people to use EVs.

“The challenge faced in

title: Police arrest three suspected of supplying Israeli man with firearms
summary: Malaysian authorities have arrested three people suspected of supplying firearms to a 36-year-old man carrying an Israeli passport, who was detained this week at a hotel in Kuala Lumpur, police said on Saturday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 30): Malaysian authorities have arrested three people suspected of supplying firearms to a 36-year-old man carrying an Israeli passport, who was detained this week at a hotel in Kuala Lumpur, police said on Saturday.

The man, arrested with a bag containing six handguns and 200 bullets, arrived at the Kuala Lumpur International Airport from the United Arab Emirates on March 12 using what authorities believed to be a fake French passport, Inspector General of Police Tan Sri Razarudin Hus

title: Another KK Supermart store attacked after 'Allah' socks outcry
summary: A Molotov cocktail was thrown into a Malaysian convenience store on Saturday, police said, after the chain's top executives were charged with hurting religious feelings for selling socks with the word 'Allah' printed on them.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 30): A Molotov cocktail was thrown into a Malaysian convenience store on Saturday, police said, after the chain's top executives were charged with hurting religious feelings for selling socks with the word 'Allah' printed on them.

Photos of the socks on sale at a KK Supermart store have sparked outrage on social media among Muslims who viewed the association of Allah — the Arabic word for God — with feet as offensive.

Religion is a sensi

title: Sighting of Syawal new moon on April 9
summary: The evening of Tuesday (April 9) has been set to sight the Syawal new moon to determine the date of Aidilfitri, the Office of the Keeper of the Rulers' Seal announced on Saturday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 30): The evening of Tuesday (April 9) has been set to sight the Syawal new moon to determine the date of Aidilfitri, the Office of the Keeper of the Rulers' Seal announced on Saturday.

It said in a statement that the Conference of Rulers had consented to setting the date for Aidilfitri based on the 'rukyah' method of sighting the new moon and the 'hisab' calculation based on mathematics and astronomy.

The Keeper of the Rulers' Seal will annou

title: The Week Ahead: Upper house to debate supplementary budget proposal
summary: This week will be relatively quiet on the corporate and economic fronts. But parliament is set for an important debate as the upper house scrutinises the supplementary budget proposal for 2023.
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on April 1, 2024 - April 7, 2024

This week will be relatively quiet on the corporate and economic fronts. But parliament is set for an important debate as the upper house scrutinises the supplementary budget proposal for 2023.

The Supplementary Supply (2023) Bill 2024 was tabled in the Dewan Rakyat on March 14 to pave the way for the government’s request for RM23.48 bil

title: M'sia looking at ways to implement concert tax incentive similar to Thailand's, says Fahmi
summary: The government is looking at ways to implement aspects similar to the Thai government’s concert tax incentive here, said Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (March 30): The government is looking at ways to implement aspects similar to the Thai government’s concert tax incentive here, said Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil.

He said the government is looking at some aspects of the tax break, and emphasised that Malaysia had something similar called Fimi or the Film in Malaysia Incentive previously.

“One proposal is to call it Cemi — Concerts and Events in Malaysia,” he told the media during Bernama

title: Spotlight on independent smallholders
summary: Plantations and Commodities Minister Datuk Seri Johari Abdul Ghani said early this month that he would like to consolidate at least 30% of the country’s independent smallholders, and form clusters of around 8,000 to 10,000 hectares (ha) in order to increase Malaysia’s crude palm oil (CPO) production.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 30): Plantations and Commodities Minister Datuk Seri Johari Abdul Ghani said early this month that he would like to consolidate at least 30% of the country’s independent smallholders, and form clusters of around 8,000 to 10,000 hectares (ha) in order to increase Malaysia’s crude palm oil (CPO) production.

His call has been well received, but many questions have been asked. Who will drive and fund the initiative? Will independent smallholders' land ownership be affected?

title: KWAP, Abrdn continue to increase stakes in CTOS
summary:
Retirement Fund Inc (KWAP) and Abrdn Malaysia Sdn Bhd have upped their stakes in credit reporting agency CTOS Digital Bhd.

Filings with Bursa showed that KWAP acquired a total of 1.51 million CTOS shares and disposed of 319,700 in the open market on Wednesday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 30): Retirement Fund Inc (KWAP) and Abrdn Malaysia Sdn Bhd have upped their stakes in credit reporting agency CTOS Digital Bhd.

Filings with Bursa showed that KWAP acquired a total of 1.51 million CTOS shares and disposed of 319,700 in the open market on Wednesday.

Following the transaction, KWAP’s stake in CTOS increased to 6.5%, equivalent to 150.18 million shares.

title: Power Play: The Hidden REC Potential of Malaysia's Hydropower Industry
summary: In Malaysia, hydropower holds a prominent position in the electrical grid, standing as one of the country's three main sustainable energy sources, alongside biomass and solar power. As of 2022, hydropower capacity stood at approximately 6.2 thousand megawatts (MW). Since 2013, Malaysia has witnessed a steady increase in hydropower capacity, with notable growth attributed to major projects led by utility companies like Tenaga Nasional Berhad (TNB) in Peninsular Malaysia, Sarawak Energy Berhad (SEB) in Sarawak, and Sabah Electricity Berhad (SESB).

title: Proper planning and management the key
summary: With more shopping malls heading their way into 2024, it’s hardly surprising that we are witnessing a glut in the sector.
content:
'CLICK TO ENLARGE'

WITH more shopping malls heading their way into 2024, it’s hardly surprising that we are witnessing a glut in the sector.

As of the fourth quarter of 2023, Malaysia boasted 1,074 shopping malls with a combined retail space of 17.69 million sq m, with the Klang Valley contributing roughly 200 shopping malls and offering a retail space of 6.5 million sq m.

title: A case of one too many malls
summary: The opening of The Exchange TRX in late November last year came with much fanfare.
content:
THE opening of The Exchange TRX in late November last year came with much fanfare.

Despite being mired with challenges such as negative press and intense competition in the local mall landscape due to the seemingly endless supply of new floor space, The Exchange TRX continues to defy expectations by attracting a significant number of visitors.

title: MKHOP seeks land for plantation in Indonesia
summary: Main Market-bound MKH Oil Palm (East Kalimantan) Bhd (MKHOP) is actively seeking land in Indonesia to expand its land bank for oil palm plantations.
content:
From left: MKHOP independent non-executive director Yahya Ariffin, executive director Emily Chen Wei Chyong, executive director Datuk Andy Lee Khee Meng, non-executive director Tan Sri Eddy.

title: Liannex’s stake buy in Icon Offshore a positive development
summary: Earlier in the week, Icon Offshore Bhd grabbed headlines when the story broke that its major shareholder, the government’s private equity (PE) fund Ekuiti Nasional Bhd (Ekuinas) is divesting most of its stake in the local offshore service vessels (OSV) provider.
